page.title: 04Sights,Sounds and Smells
page.content:
{ Part of two poems by two 12 year {olds, describing part of Shiney Row.} -------------------------------------- The green yellow fields almost everywhere, The smell of the sewers and the beck, The sound of birds chirping loudly, The distant monument in sight.
The main colour I see is green, Then the red-brown terraced houses, The brightly coloured pigeon crees, The flags flying from the YMCA. -------------------------------------- A smokey smell from the houses, Pigs chod* from the pig farm, The spring wiff in the air, The becks sewer pong, The flowers and bushes all over the fields, The grass with its summer glow. {*pigs dung.}
